Title: Quarterly report
Description.note: Report includes chronology detailing incarceration process from 1941 December 7 to 1942 June 29 and gives brief descriptions of incarceration camp sites.
Description.fundingNote: Digitization of these materials has been generously supported as part of the OpenUCLA Centennial Initiative.

Title: Quarterly report
Description.note: Report covers employment statistics within incarceration camps, leave regulations, college student forced removal, and general aspects of life in incarceration camps, such as education, mess operations, religious activities, and the fears and anxieties of incarcerees.
Description.fundingNote: Digitization of these materials has been generously supported as part of the OpenUCLA Centennial Initiative.
Name.repository: University of California, Los Angeles. Library. Department of Special Collections
Rights.servicesContact: UCLA Library Special Collections, A1713 Charles E. Young Research Library, Box 951575, Los Angeles, CA 90095-1575. Email: spec-coll@library.ucla.edu. Phone: (310) 825-4988

Title: Quarterly report
Description.note: Report covers general aspects of life in incarceration camps, including forced removal progress, employment of incarcerees, and repatriation. Included is a description of a strike at the Potson camp and a riot at Manzanar.
Description.fundingNote: Digitization of these materials has been generously supported as part of the OpenUCLA Centennial Initiative.
Name.repository: University of California, Los Angeles. Library. Department of Special Collections
Rights.servicesContact: UCLA Library Special Collections, A1713 Charles E. Young Research Library, Box 951575, Los Angeles, CA 90095-1575. Email: spec-coll@library.ucla.edu. Phone: (310) 825-4988

Title: Semi-annual report
Description.note: Report covers general aspects of life in incarceration camps, including mess hall operations, recreation, and education. Also details Senate Sub-committee investigation, Spanish Consular visit, isolation procedures, and segregation procedures for pro-Japanese and pro-American incarcerees.
Description.fundingNote: Digitization of these materials has been generously supported as part of the OpenUCLA Centennial Initiative.

Rights.servicesContact: UCLA Library Special Collections, A1713 Charles E. Young Research Library, Box 951575, Los Angeles, CA 90095-1575. Email: spec-coll@library.ucla.edu. Phone: (310) 825-4988

Title: Semi-annual report
Description.note: Report covers general aspects of life in incarceration camps, including segregation process and problems. Details Tule Lake Incident and November 1 demonstration at Tule Lake Hospital. Fold-out map of Tule Lake included.
Description.fundingNote: Digitization of these materials has been generously supported as part of the OpenUCLA Centennial Initiative.
Name.repository: University of California, Los Angeles. Library. Department of Special Collections
Rights.servicesContact: UCLA Library Special Collections, A1713 Charles E. Young Research Library, Box 951575, Los Angeles, CA 90095-1575. Email: spec-coll@library.ucla.edu. Phone: (310) 825-4988

Title: Semi-annual report
Description.note: Documents the WRA's transfer from independent war agency to Department of the Interior. Includes general description of life in incarceration camps, including reaction of incarcerees and enlistment. Includes report of the House Sub-Committee on the Tule Lake Incident, the closing of the Jerome Relocation Center, and tables and charts showing average incarceration camp populations.
Description.fundingNote: Digitization of these materials has been generously supported as part of the OpenUCLA Centennial Initiative.
Name.repository: University of California, Los Angeles. Library. Department of Special Collections
Rights.servicesContact: UCLA Library Special Collections, A1713 Charles E. Young Research Library, Box 951575, Los Angeles, CA 90095-1575. Email: spec-coll@library.ucla.edu. Phone: (310) 825-4988

Title: Semi-annual report
Description.note: Report discussed resettlement procedures, housing problems, incarceree attitudes, the children's village at Manzanar, and labor attitudes of the Congress of Industrial Organizations (CIO) and the American Federation of Labor (AFL). Details the West Coast opposition toward Japanese American resettlement, including boycotts, terrorist incidents, and legal issues regarding ownership of property.
Description.fundingNote: Digitization of these materials has been generously supported as part of the OpenUCLA Centennial Initiative.
Name.repository: University of California, Los Angeles. Library. Department of Special Collections
Rights.servicesContact: UCLA Library Special Collections, A1713 Charles E. Young Research Library, Box 951575, Los Angeles, CA 90095-1575. Email: spec-coll@library.ucla.edu. Phone: (310) 825-4988

Title: Semi-annual report
Description.note: Report summarizes resettlement, liquidation, and departure process from various incarceration camps. Resettlement issues of Tule Lake incarcerees are discussed, including renunciants and the declining influence of the Hoshidan (pro-Japanese societies).
Description.fundingNote: Digitization of these materials has been generously supported as part of the OpenUCLA Centennial Initiative.
Name.repository: University of California, Los Angeles. Library. Department of Special Collections
Rights.servicesContact: UCLA Library Special Collections, A1713 Charles E. Young Research Library, Box 951575, Los Angeles, CA 90095-1575. Email: spec-coll@library.ucla.edu. Phone: (310) 825-4988

Title: Final semi-annual report
Description.note: Report documents the end of the WRA, as of June 30, 1946, including the forced removal of Tule Lake residents; renunciant hearings; closing of Tule Lake; and a general summary of incarceration processes.
Description.fundingNote: Digitization of these materials has been generously supported as part of the OpenUCLA Centennial Initiative.
Name.repository: University of California, Los Angeles. Library. Department of Special Collections
Rights.servicesContact: UCLA Library Special Collections, A1713 Charles E. Young Research Library, Box 951575, Los Angeles, CA 90095-1575. Email: spec-coll@library.ucla.edu. Phone: (310) 825-4988

Title: Address. Ben Kuroki
Description.note: Address by Sergeant Ben Kuroki, U.S. Army Air Force, before the Commonwealth Club, San Francisco, CA (sponsored by the WRA). Details Kuroki's experience with racial prejudice while in the army, and calls for the humane treatment of Japanese Americans in the future. Kuroki was previously awarded with two Distinguished Flying Cross Medals.
Description.fundingNote: Digitization of these materials has been generously supported as part of the OpenUCLA Centennial Initiative.
Name.repository: University of California, Los Angeles. Library. Department of Special Collections
Rights.servicesContact: UCLA Library Special Collections, A1713 Charles E. Young Research Library, Box 951575, Los Angeles, CA 90095-1575. Email: spec-coll@library.ucla.edu. Phone: (310) 825-4988

Title: Address. Dillon S. Myer. "One Thousandth of A Nation"
Description.note: Address by the Director of the WRA, before a joint meeting of civic organizations in Salt Lake City, UT. Includes descriptions of life in the incarceration camps, and argues for the resettlement of Japanese Americans.
Description.fundingNote: Digitization of these materials has been generously supported as part of the OpenUCLA Centennial Initiative.
Name.repository: University of California, Los Angeles. Library. Department of Special Collections
Rights.servicesContact: UCLA Library Special Collections, A1713 Charles E. Young Research Library, Box 951575, Los Angeles, CA 90095-1575. Email: spec-coll@library.ucla.edu. Phone: (310) 825-4988

Title: Address. Dillon S. Myer. "Problems of Evacuee Resettlement in California"
Description.note: Address by the Director of the WRA in Eagle Rock, CA. Provides brief overview of forced removal process after 1943 and argues for resettlement of Japanese Americans.
Description.fundingNote: Digitization of these materials has been generously supported as part of the OpenUCLA Centennial Initiative.
Name.repository: University of California, Los Angeles. Library. Department of Special Collections
Rights.servicesContact: UCLA Library Special Collections, A1713 Charles E. Young Research Library, Box 951575, Los Angeles, CA 90095-1575. Email: spec-coll@library.ucla.edu. Phone: (310) 825-4988

Title: Address. Dillon S. Myer. "Relocation Problems and Policies"
Description.note: Address by the Director of the WRA, before the Tuesday Evening Club in Pasadena, CA. Details the operations of the incarceration centers in response to Hearst newspapers' claims that incarcerees were coddled; Meyer also contends that Japanese Americans must be protected and allowed to resettle.
Description.fundingNote: Digitization of these materials has been generously supported as part of the OpenUCLA Centennial Initiative.

Title: Address. Dillon S. Myer. "The Facts About the War Relocation Authority"
Description.note: Address by the Director of the WRA, before a luncheon meeting of the Los Angeles Town Hall, Los Angeles, CA.
Description.fundingNote: Digitization of these materials has been generously supported as part of the OpenUCLA Centennial Initiative.

Title: Community Government in War Relocation Centers
Description.note: Report on the development of internal governments run by incarcerees. Subjects include the problems and confusion surrounding the Poston Strike and Manzanar Riot, community organization, and the future of Japanese American communities.
Description.fundingNote: Digitization of these materials has been generously supported as part of the OpenUCLA Centennial Initiative.

Title: The Evacuated People: A Quantitative Description
Description.note: Report on the experiences of incarcerees at incarceration camps, moving, segregation, settling into camps, and resettlement.
Description.fundingNote: Digitization of these materials has been generously supported as part of the OpenUCLA Centennial Initiative.

Title: Impounded People: Japanese Americans in the Relocation Centers
Description.note: Report on constitutional issues involved in the forced removal process, the WRA's legal framework, and the organization of the Office of the Solicitor.
Description.fundingNote: Digitization of these materials has been generously supported as part of the OpenUCLA Centennial Initiative.

Title: Legal and Constitutional Phases of the WRA Program
Description.note: Pamphlet designed to ease agitation and anti-Japanese American sentiment. Questions addressed include: Japanese religion and ties to emperor, Japanese Language Schools, Nisei (a person born in the US or Canada whose parents were immigrants from Japan) in the Army, honesty of the Japanese as a race, assimilability of the Japanese, agricultural Competition, and coddling by the WRA.
Description.fundingNote: Digitization of these materials has been generously supported as part of the OpenUCLA Centennial Initiative.

Rights.servicesContact: UCLA Library Special Collections, A1713 Charles E. Young Research Library, Box 951575, Los Angeles, CA 90095-1575. Email: spec-coll@library.ucla.edu. Phone: (310) 825-4988

Title: "Message from the National Director to the Residents of Relocation Centers"
Description.note: Open letter instructing incarcerees about resettlement, including timely departure from incarceration camps and camp closing dates.

Title: Myths and Facts About the Japanese Americans: Answering Common Misconceptions Regarding Americans of Japanese Ancestry
Description.note: Reprinted newspaper articles on the bravery and sacrifices of Japanese American soldiers in World War II. Newspapers include Los Angeles Times, Tacoma News-Times, Chicago Tribune, and Omaha World Herald.

Title: Nisei in the War Against Japan
Description.note: Illustrated pamphlet on Japanese Americans in the 442nd Regimental Combat Team and 100th Battalion. Includes an article about Ben Kuroki, the only American of Japanese descent in the United States Army Air Forces to serve in combat operations in the Pacific theater of World War II.
Description.fundingNote: Digitization of these materials has been generously supported as part of the OpenUCLA Centennial Initiative.
